Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or proof to support the assertion that ISKCON devotees were attacked by police in West Bengal.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video showing men being harassed by men in khaki uniform represents an attack on ISKCON devotees by West Bengal police, without considering alternative explanations or additional context.
Exist alternative explanation: The video has been debunked and proven to be from a different incident in Goa in 2008, involving clashes between Russian members of the Hare Rama Hare Krishna sect and the police.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video does not depict an attack on ISKCON devotees in West Bengal, but rather a different incident in Goa.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting misleading information and spreading misinformation in the run-up to polling in West Bengal.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the claim.
Exaggerate: There is no evidence of exaggeration bias in the claim.
